name: Ref docs - Issued drawings / Site copy drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Check that you have the latest site and engineering drawings BEFORE starting each task/set of tasks.
Acceptance Criteria - Lots to be broken up accordingly and outlined on a lot map
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Has the pavement been set out by an accredited Surveyor?
Acceptance Criteria - Provide all mix designs. Mix design is to be assessed by the Superintendent for compliance.
○ Mix design to be approved by Superintendent before use.
Notice: 14 working days before using mix
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Is the Binder within 0.3% of total mix?
○ Has the daily particle size distribution been within tolerance?
○ Has the daily moisture content been within tolerance – not to exceed 0.5% on completion of mixing?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Do the temperatures listed below comply with requirements for max. temperature?
– Class 170, Class 320, Class AR450 Bitumen delivered into mixer – 165ºC
– Class 600 Bitumen delivered into mixer – 175 ºC
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Has each delivery come with a certificate of compliance?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Has the previous layer passed acceptance criteria? Refer to ITP of previous layer.
Acceptance Criteria - Transverse joints shall be offset by not less than 2m in adjoining paver runs and from later to layer.
Longitudinal joints shall meet the following requirements:
– Wearing course joint coincide with location of intended traffic lane lines
– Intermediate and base course offset from layer to layer by not less than 150mm provided that no joint is placed directly below a trafficked wheel path
○ Location of planned joints is a Hold Point.
Acceptance Criteria - Unless otherwise directed, tack coat is to be applied to provide a uniform application rate of residual binder of between 0.10L/m2 and 0.20L/m2
○ Is the application rate for tack coat between the following?
Acceptance Criteria - Has approval to proceed been obtained from the Superintendent?
Notice: 7 working days before commencing production
Acceptance Criteria - Is the area essentially dry and free of surface water?
○ Does the surface temperature meet requirements?
Ref docs - Drawings Spec. 1144 Asphaltic Concrete [Cl 3.4]
Acceptance Criteria - Has the asphalt been spread in layers at compacted thicknesses as per the drawings:
○ Has all asphalt been spread with a purpose designed asphalt paving machine to form a uniformly smooth asphalt mat?
○ Does the width of a single paving run not exceed 6m?
Acceptance Criteria - Uniformly compact asphalt to below requirements as soon as the asphalt has cooled sufficiently.
○ Confirm Frequency of testing and target requirements
Tested to the following criteria (acceptable values to be calculated bases off formula in standard):
– Density ratio greater than 94% for thickness less than 50mm
– Density ratio greater than 96% for thickness greater than 50mm
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt shall be consistent and uniform?
○ Top of asphalt shall be not more than 10mm above specified level?
○ Asphalt against the kerb and channel shall be flush or not more than 5mm above the lip of the channel?
○ Do no points on the finished surface lie more than below (medium to light traffic roads):
– 7mm below a 3m straight edge for wearing course
– 10mm below a 3m straight edge for wearing course
4.2 - Survey pickup (Top layer only, N/A for all intermediate layers)
Acceptance Criteria - Has the prepared layer been surveyed in accordance with and verifying specified requirements?
○ The horizontal location of any point on the pavement not to vary by more than ± 50mm from the corresponding points shown on the documents, expect where alignment with existing is required.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
